How can I contact RMU?
You can contact RMU via phone at +233 302 712775 or email at university.registrar@rmu.edu.gh.
Give an overview of RMU?
RMU is a tertiary institution with diplomatic status located in Accra, Ghana. Founded by Cameroon, Gambia, Ghana, Liberia, Sierra Leone.
Contact Info of RMU?
Address: P.O. BOX GP1115, Nungua, Accra – Ghana, West Africa. Phone: +233 302 712775 - Email: university.registrar@rmu.edu.gh / marketing@rmu.edu.gh
What are the Application Fees?
For BSc. programmes: GHC200.00 / $50.00. - Diploma programmes: GHC150.00 / $40.00. - Postgraduate programmes: GHC250.00 / $70.00.
How is Payment done?
USSD Code: *447*8#. or on Approved Sales Centres either at the RMU Cash Office or All Branches of Ghana Commercial Bank/Ecobank
Provide Foreign Applicant Admission Guidelines

Application Process: - 	Request an application code by providing your email address. - Receive a Card Number and PIN via email. - Use these credentials to access and complete the online registration forms. - Print the completed form and attach photocopies of relevant certificates. - Send the documents to: The Registrar, Regional Maritime University, P.O. Box GP 1115, Accra – 		Ghana
How much paid for Processing Fees:
For Masters/Upgraders programmes: $70.00. For BSc. programmes: $50.00 and for Diploma/MEM programmes: $40.00
What Payment Methods can I use?
International Money Order payable to RMU or Direct payment at any Ecobank Branch or Affiliate to the specified RMU account.

How was RMU formed?

RMU was established in 2007, evolved from Ghana Nautical College (1958). Formerly known as Regional Maritime Academy. It is an international tertiary institution for maritime education in West and Central Africa.
What is the mission of RMU?
The mission of RMU is to provide quality education and training in maritime and allied fields to meet the needs of the global maritime industry.
What are the core values of RMU?
RMU's core values include discipline, excellence, integrity, teamwork, innovation, and commitment to quality service.
What are the objectives of RMU?
The objectives of RMU are to offer high quality academic programs, promote research and consultancy, develop competent maritime professionals, and provide support services to the maritime industry.
What is an elective course at RMU?
An elective course is a subject that students choose from a list to supplement their core courses, depending on their interests or career path.
What does credit hour mean at RMU?
A credit hour represents one hour of lecture or a minimum of two hours of practical or laboratory work per week per semester.
What is the academic year at RMU composed of?
A standard academic year at RMU consists of two semesters with breaks in between and may include a long vacation period.
What is a pass grade at RMU?
A pass grade is a mark equal to or higher than the minimum requirement set by the academic board for successful course completion.
What is a re-sit examination at RMU?
A re-sit examination is a second opportunity given to a student who failed a course to retake the exam within a specified period.
How is a course coded at RMU?
Course codes at RMU consist of four letters and three numbers. The first digit indicates the year of the course, and the last two digits represent the course's serial number.
What happens if a student cannot complete their study within the maximum period at RMU?
Students who cannot complete their studies within the maximum duration may be withdrawn from the program unless otherwise permitted by the university.
What does the RMU Student Handbook contain?
The handbook contains information on student conduct, examination discipline, grading systems, hostel policies, academic departments, and a course list for all available programmes.
Why is the RMU Student Handbook considered indispensable?
It is indispensable because reading and adhering to its rules and regulations ensures students are found worthy in character and learning—two important attributes of an RMU graduate.
What are the key objectives of RMU?

The objectives include promoting knowledge through teaching and research, producing skilled manpower for the maritime industry, and collaborating with other institutions to enhance academic excellence and professional development.
What does the RMU University Logo represent?
The RMU University Logo reflects the University's identity and its commitment to excellence in maritime education and training across Africa.
Why is the RMU Logo important?
The logo serves as a symbol of the University's values, professionalism, and its role in producing competent maritime professionals.
When was the Regional Maritime University (RMU) established?
The RMU was established in 2007 as a tertiary institution with diplomatic status under the auspices of the Ministry of Transport and the Government of Ghana.
What is the origin of RMU?
RMU evolved from the Ghana Nautical College, which was established in 1958 to train officers for the Ghana Merchant Navy and other maritime institutions.
What led to the transformation from Ghana Nautical College to RMU?
The transformation was driven by regional collaboration among maritime nations in West and Central Africa and the need for a regional maritime training institution.
What is the language of instruction at RMU?
The official language of instruction at RMU is English.
What types of students does RMU admit?
RMU admits both male and female students from Ghana and other countries, particularly within the West and Central African sub-regions.
Is RMU a co-educational institution?
Yes, RMU is a co-educational university, admitting both male and female students.
Is RMU affiliated with international organizations?
Yes, RMU is a regional institution supported by member states in West and Central Africa and collaborates with international maritime organizations.
Why was the Ghana Nautical College regionalized?
The College was regionalized to serve the needs of English-speaking West and Central African countries, transforming it into a regional maritime training center.
What organizations supported the transformation of Ghana Nautical College to RMU?
The transformation was supported by the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) and the International Maritime Organization (IMO).
When did RMU gain full university status?
RMU attained full university status on October 25, 2007.
What facilities are found on the RMU campus?
Facilities include lecture halls, laboratories, workshops, student hostels, staff accommodation, a library, a clinic, sports facilities, and a maritime simulation center.
What is unique about the RMU campus location?
The RMU campus is uniquely positioned along the coast, offering students direct exposure to the maritime environment and practical training in a realistic setting.
Does RMU provide hostel accommodation?
Yes, RMU provides hostel accommodation for students with separate facilities for males and females located on campus.
Are there medical facilities on campus at RMU?
Yes, RMU has a campus clinic that provides basic healthcare services to students and staff.
How does RMU maintain quality assurance?
The University applies continuous quality assurance processes including internal audits, reviews, and performance monitoring across all departments.
How does RMU maintain quality assurance?
The University applies continuous quality assurance processes including internal audits, reviews, and performance monitoring across all departments.
What is the purpose of RMU's management system?
RMU’s management system aims to ensure consistency, transparency, and continual improvement in the administration of teaching, learning, and research activities.
What international standards does RMU’s management system comply with?
RMU's management system complies with ISO 9001:2008 standards, which guide its quality management and continuous improvement efforts.
What does RMU use internal audits for?
Internal audits at RMU are used to assess compliance with established procedures, identify areas for improvement, and ensure quality standards are met.
Who oversees the implementation of the management system at RMU?
The implementation is overseen by the university's quality assurance and academic planning units under the supervision of senior management.
How often is the RMU management system reviewed?
RMU reviews its management system regularly as part of its commitment to continuous improvement and accountability.
What role does feedback play in RMU’s management system?
Feedback from students, faculty, and stakeholders is used to assess performance, inform decisions, and improve services and academic delivery.
Why is the ISO 9001:2008 standard important to RMU?
It ensures that RMU's management processes are internationally recognized, efficient, and focused on customer satisfaction and continual improvement.
What kind of environment does the RMU campus promote?
The RMU campus promotes a serene, professional, and academically conducive environment for both learning and maritime training.
What academic and technical resources are available at RMU?
RMU offers well-equipped laboratories, maritime simulation centers, and workshops to support hands-on technical and maritime training.
Does RMU provide hostel accommodation?
Yes, RMU provides hostel accommodation for students with separate facilities for males and females located on campus.
Are there medical facilities on campus at RMU?
Yes, RMU has a campus clinic that provides basic healthcare services to students and staff.
What sports facilities are available at RMU?
RMU has sports facilities that support physical education and recreational activities for students.
What types of workshops are available at RMU?
RMU offers technical workshops in engineering and maritime studies that allow students to gain hands-on skills relevant to their field of study.

The official language of instruction at RMU is English.

RMU admits both male and female students from Ghana and other countries, particularly within the West and Central African sub-regions.

Yes, RMU is a co-educational university, admitting both male and female students.

RMU promotes a disciplined academic environment that emphasizes professionalism and high standards.
What is RMU's approach to student discipline?
RMU enforces strict discipline policies to ensure students maintain high ethical standards and professional conduct.
Is RMU affiliated with international organizations?
Yes, RMU is a regional institution supported by member states in West and Central Africa and collaborates with international maritime organizations.
Does RMU provide practical training in its programs?
Yes, RMU combines theoretical knowledge with practical training to ensure students are prepared for real-world maritime and technical challenges.
What type of programs does RMU specialize in?
RMU specializes in maritime education and related disciplines, offering both academic and professional training.
What is the role of the Vice Chancellor at RMU?
The Vice Chancellor oversees the university's overall operations, academic programs, and strategic development.
Who supports the Vice Chancellor at RMU?
The Vice Chancellor is supported by the Pro-Vice Chancellor, Registrar, Director of Finance, and other senior officials.
What is the responsibility of the Registrar at RMU?
The Registrar is responsible for the university's administrative functions and serves as the secretary to the governing council.
Who handles the university’s finances?
The Director of Finance manages RMU's financial planning, budgeting, and expenditure.
What role does the University Librarian play?
The University Librarian is responsible for managing the library and supporting academic research and learning.
What are the duties of the Deans at RMU?
Deans oversee the academic and administrative activities of their respective faculties and ensure the quality of programs offered.
Who ensures the quality of academic programs at RMU?
The Pro-Vice Chancellor works closely with academic units to ensure quality assurance in teaching and research.
What is the role of the Academic Board at RMU?
The Academic Board is responsible for regulating academic matters, approving programs, and maintaining academic standards.
Who ensures compliance with university regulations at RMU?
The Registrar ensures compliance with university regulations and coordinates all non-academic administrative services.
How is academic leadership distributed at RMU?
Academic leadership is distributed through the Deans, Heads of Departments, and the Academic Board who collectively manage academic affairs.
What is the role of the Pro-Vice Chancellor in student affairs?
The Pro-Vice Chancellor supports student development, ensures academic compliance, and helps maintain academic discipline and standards.
Which departments fall under the Faculty of Engineering at RMU?
Departments under the Faculty of Engineering include Marine Engineering, Electrical/Electronic Engineering, and Computer Engineering.
What does the Faculty of International Business and Management Studies offer?
This faculty offers programs in Procurement and Supply Chain Management, Logistics Management, and Port and Shipping Administration.
Which programs are under the Faculty of Maritime Studies?
The Faculty of Maritime Studies includes programs in Nautical Science and Marine Engineering with practical seafaring training.
What is the focus of the Marine Engineering department?
The Marine Engineering department trains students in the design, operation, and maintenance of ship engines and maritime machinery.
What does the Nautical Science department at RMU specialize in?
The Nautical Science department focuses on navigation, ship handling, and the safe operation of vessels.
Is there a Computer Engineering department at RMU?

Yes, RMU has an Information and Communication department that trains students in software, hardware, and computer systems related to maritime and industrial applications. The courses provided are Information technology, Computer Science and Computer Engineering.
What are the responsibilities of academic departments at RMU?
Departments handle curriculum development, course delivery, faculty coordination, research promotion, and student academic guidance.
Who leads a department at RMU?
Each department is headed by a Head of Department (HOD) who is responsible for its academic and administrative operations.
Can students choose electives outside their department at RMU?
Yes, students may be allowed to take approved elective courses from other departments based on program requirements.
Are interdisciplinary programs available at RMU?
RMU encourages interdisciplinary learning by integrating business, engineering, and maritime operations into applicable programs.
How is practical training integrated in RMU faculties?
Practical training is embedded into course structures through workshops, labs, internships, and simulation exercises.
Does RMU offer diploma programs under these faculties?
Yes, various diploma programs are offered including Diploma in Nautical Science, Marine Engineering, and Electrical/Electronics.
Are there postgraduate programs in any RMU faculty?
Postgraduate options exist in Logistics, Supply Chain, Maritime Studies, and Engineering, with growing interest in research-based degrees.
How does RMU ensure quality in its academic departments?
Departments undergo regular reviews, engage industry experts, and follow national and international accreditation standards.
Does RMU admit international students?
Yes, RMU admits international students, especially from English-speaking countries in West and Central Africa.
How are admission decisions made at RMU?
Admission decisions are made by the Admissions Committee based on the applicant’s qualifications and compliance with entry requirements.
Is there a quota system in RMU admissions?
Admissions are merit-based, and while there may be consideration for regional diversity, there is no strict quota system.
Are there reserved slots for students from member states?
Yes, RMU gives special consideration to applicants from its five member states: Ghana, Liberia, Sierra Leone, The Gambia, and Cameroon.
What level of education must applicants have to be considered for undergraduate admission?
Applicants must have completed secondary education and passed required subjects in the WASSCE, SSSCE, or an equivalent qualification.
Can mature applicants apply to RMU?
Yes, RMU allows mature applicants who may not meet the standard entry qualifications but pass a special entrance exam.
Does RMU consider professional experience in its admissions?
For some programs, relevant professional experience may be considered, especially for diploma or continuing education applicants.
Are there bridging or preparatory programs at RMU?
Yes, RMU may offer bridging courses for applicants who do not fully meet subject requirements but show potential.
Is English language proficiency required at RMU?
Yes, applicants must demonstrate proficiency in English as it is the language of instruction at RMU.
Does RMU accept students from non-Anglophone countries?
Yes, but such students may be required to demonstrate English proficiency or undertake language support programs.
Are admission requirements the same for all programs?
No, specific programs have unique subject requirements and cutoff points in addition to the general admission criteria.
Can students transfer from other universities to RMU?
Yes, RMU considers transfer students on a case-by-case basis depending on academic standing and course equivalency.
What is the process for applying to RMU?
Applicants must purchase an application voucher, complete the form online, upload required documents, and submit by the deadline.

What is the minimum age requirement to apply to RMU?
Applicants must be at least 16 years old for undergraduate programs unless otherwise specified by RMU regulations.

What grading system is used at RMU?

RMU uses the following grading scale:

| Grade | % Mark | Grade Point (GP) | Interpretation |
|-------|--------|------------------|----------------|
| A     | 80–100 | 4.00             | Outstanding    |
| A-    |        | 3.85             | Excellent      |
| B+    | 75–79  | 3.50             | Very Good      |
| B     | 70–74  | 3.00             | Good           |
| C+    | 65–69  | 2.50             | Above Average  |
| C     | 60–64  | 2.00             | Average        |

Other notations: X = Fail, Z = Disqualified, I = Incomplete, Y = Continuing, S = Sick, M = Owing
How is GPA and CGPA calculated at RMU?

GPA (Grade Point Average) per semester is calculated as:
GPA = (Sum of Credit Hours × Grade Points) / Total Credit Hours

CGPA (Cumulative GPA) is the average of GPA across all semesters.
What is the classification of degrees based on CGPA at RMU?

CGPA and Classification:
- 3.60 and above: 1st Class
- 3.00 – 3.59: 2nd Class Upper
- 2.50 – 2.99: 2nd Class Lower
- 2.00 – 2.49: 3rd Class
- 1.50 – 1.99: Pass
- Below 1.49: Fail (No Certificate)
Can you give an example of GPA calculation?

Example:
Course 1 (3 credits, Grade B = 3.0) → 9.0 WGP
Course 2 (2 credits, Grade C+ = 2.5) → 5.0 WGP
Course 3 (3 credits, Grade C = 2.0) → 6.0 WGP
Course 4 (1 credit, Grade D = 1.0) → 1.0 WGP
Total WGP = 21.0, Total Credits = 9
GPA = 21 / 9 = 2.33

What are the key regulations governing student organizations at RMU?

1. Only registered RMU students may join; others require special provision in the group’s constitution.
2. Organizations must maintain proper financial records. All funds are subject to Student Welfare Board oversight.
3. Coordinators must accept responsibility for all group activities.
4. Affiliated organizations may apply for funding, but the sponsoring department is jointly accountable.
5. No organization may act on behalf of RMU without official approval.
6. All organizations must comply with University regulations. Infractions may lead to sanctions.
7. Registration must be renewed each academic session, with submission of:
   * Staff adviser’s name and signature
   * Names of current leaders and their department/hall
   * Copy of previous year’s constitution and by-laws
   * Approved schedule of meetings and events
How can a student request a transcript of academic records at RMU?

Submit a written request to the Registrar’s Office, pay the required fee, and provide advance notice. The transcript includes only academic records from RMU. No transcript will be released if financial obligations are not met, and grades earned cannot be deleted under any circumstance.
Who is eligible to sit for exams at RMU?
Students must meet all Departmental requirements and attend at least 75% of contact hours. Attendance at lectures, practicals, and tutorials is mandatory.
How are students assessed at RMU?
Evaluation is based on Continuous Assessment (40%) and End-of-Semester Exams (60%). Assessments include essays, quizzes, tests, reports, and oral/project work. The pass mark is 45% for all courses.
What are the rules for deferment of examinations at RMU?

Students deferring due to ill-health must submit a medical certificate to the Registrar through the Head of Department. For other reasons, students must write formally to the Provost via the HoD and Dean and obtain written permission from the Registrar before deferring.
How are examination results declared at RMU?

The Department Examination Committee submits results to the Faculty Board and then to the Academic Council. Final results are posted on official notice boards. Students may obtain printed statements after publication. Results for graduates go to the Registrar after Academic Council approval.
What is RMU’s policy on academic progression and withdrawal?

Progression is based on CGPA and minimum credits passed at each level. Level 100: Pass (CGPA ≥ 1.50), Repeat (CGPA 1.00–1.49), Withdraw (CGPA < 1.00). Level 200: Pass (CGPA ≥ 1.50 + ≥ 24 credits), Probation (CGPA ≥ 1.50 + 18–23 credits), Withdraw (below threshold). Level 300: Pass (CGPA ≥ 1.50 + ≥ 60 credits), Probation (CGPA ≥ 1.50 + 48–59 credits), Withdraw (below threshold). After a year of probation without improvement, withdrawal may be enforced by the Registrar.

What are the guidelines for credit transfer at the Regional Maritime University (RMU)?

The RMU follows the guidelines below for credit transfer and academic standards:

1. Transfer credit from regionally accredited colleges or universities may be accepted if the courses are parallel in nature to RMU programmes. The process must begin after official admission.
2. Only courses with a grade of D or better can be transferred. However, prerequisite and major courses may require higher grades.
3. All transfer work is subject to audit and re-evaluation.
4. The Admissions Office evaluates whether courses are equivalent and applicable to RMU's graduation requirements. Academic departments assess if transferred courses align with degree programmes.
5. Students holding an Associate of Arts or Associate of Science from accredited foreign institutions may be deemed to have completed general education requirements.
6. Degrees from accredited institutions are evaluated to determine if they satisfy RMU’s general education requirements.
7. Associate of Applied Science or similar degrees may not meet general education criteria.
8. Religious credits (non-theory-based) are not counted toward graduation requirements.

What is the historical background of the Regional Maritime University?

The Regional Maritime University (RMU) is an autonomous international institution focused on maritime training, education, research, and consultancy. It originated from the Ghana Nautical College, which was handed over to MINCONMAR (now MOWCA) and renamed the Regional Maritime Academy (RMA).

What is the extended history of RMU and how did it evolve?

The Ghana Nautical College was created in 1958. In 1983, it was regionalized by MINCONMAR, later MOWCA, and became the Regional Maritime Academy. What is the full historical background of the Regional Maritime University (RMU)?

On 11th December 1958, the Ghana Nautical College was established by the Government of Ghana to train sea-going personnel for the national line, the Black Star Line Limited.

On 26th May 1983, the Ghana Nautical College was regionalized by the Ministerial Conference of West and Central African States on Maritime Transport (MINCONMAR), now the Maritime Organization of West and Central Africa (MOWCA). Recognizing the role of human resource development in maritime sectors, MOWCA proposed converting the college into a regional maritime training institution: the Regional Maritime University (RMU), to benefit Anglophone member states.

After over 24 years of existence, RMU was upgraded from a diploma-awarding to a degree-awarding institution. It was officially launched on 25th October 2007 by the President of the Republic of Ghana.

RMU is founded by five member countries of the MOWCA assembly: the Republics of Cameroon, The Gambia, Ghana, Liberia, and Sierra Leone.

Initially, RMU focused on vocational and professional training to meet manpower needs of merchant and fishing fleets. This training evolved over time to include future-oriented education.

In response to labor shortages and maritime industry demands, the University introduced higher diploma and competency-based programs. With ongoing technological advancement and global maritime changes, RMU advanced many of its programs to the Postgraduate level.

Diploma programs continue to target mid-to-high-level manpower development for the maritime and allied industries.

Where is the Regional Maritime University (RMU) located?

RMU is located at Nungua in the Ledzokuku Krowor District, Accra, Ghana. It lies to the North-West of the Gulf of Guinea and West of the Mukwe Lagoon, approximately 30 kilometres from Kotoka International Airport.
What is unique about RMU's geographical position?

RMU is situated on the coastline, offering access to an extensive shoreline. Its proximity to the Port of Tema (about five minutes’ drive) gives students practical exposure in ship operation, fisheries, and dry dock repair.
How does RMU’s location support academic life?
The university's distance from city noise offers a calm and peaceful environment ideal for teaching and learning.
What is the role of the Vice Chancellor at the Regional Maritime University?

The Vice Chancellor is the Chief Academic and Administrative Head of the University and also the Chief Disciplinary Officer. Operating under the Board of Governors, the VC oversees financial and administrative business in accordance with University rules. The VC is an ex-officio member of the Governing Board, Academic Council, Congregation, and all Standing Committees.
What is the Academic Council and what are its responsibilities at RMU?

The Academic Council manages and formulates RMU’s academic policies. Members include the Vice Chancellor, Pro-Vice Chancellor, Registrar, Director of Finance, Deans, HoDs, and Faculty Representatives. The Registrar serves as Secretary.
What are the specific functions of RMU's Academic Council?
Functions include approving curricula, setting admission and progression criteria, regulating research, awarding scholarships, overseeing exams, and reviewing instructional and academic programs.
What are the committees under the Academic Council at RMU?

The Academic Council operates through subcommittees such as:
- Faculty Boards
- Library Committee
- Curriculum Committee
- Examination Malpractices Investigation Committee
- Student Affairs Committee
What student facilities and services are available on campus at the Regional Maritime University (RMU)?

RMU offers student accommodation, a gym, mess hall, and events organized by the Entertainment Committee. Sports facilities include a tennis court, basketball court, volleyball pitch, football park, and gymnasium. A medical centre staffed with qualified professionals provides healthcare. RMU collaborates with global institutions like Bernard Schulte, Shanghai Maritime University, GMA, GPHA, MODEC, DEME, and more for academic and training support.
What academic programs are offered by the Department of Marine Engineering (ME)?

The Department offers Bachelor’s degrees in Marine Engineering and Mechanical Engineering, along with short courses and simulator-based training for marine engine operations on ships and offshore platforms.
What does the Department of Marine Electrical/Electronic Engineering (MEEE) specialize in?

It specializes in shipboard automation and electrical systems, offering Bachelor’s degrees in Electrical and Electronic Engineering, and training on PLCs, control systems, and diagnostics using GMDSS labs.
What programs are available in the Department of Information, Communication and Technology (ICT)?
It offers Bachelor's degrees in Information Technology, Computer Science, and Computer Engineering, preparing students for careers in software, hardware, networking, and systems development.
What is taught in the Department of Nautical Science (NS)?
Students are trained in shipboard operations, bridge simulations, and certification courses like the Deck Officer Certificate of Competency for both onboard and shore transport systems management.
What does the Department of Transport (DPT) offer?
The department offers BSc and diploma programs in Ports and Shipping Management and Transport Administration with a focus on logistics, documentation, and maritime operations.
What is the role of the Maritime Safety and Security Centre (MSSC)?
The MSSC provides IMO-aligned short safety courses for seafarers, covering onboard safety practices and protocols for safer and cleaner shipping.

What are the general admission requirements for B.Sc. Marine Engineering, Electrical/Electronics Engineering, Nautical Science, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, and Mechanical Engineering at RMU?

Admission into these programs requires any of the following:

1. WASSCE: Credits in English, Math, Integrated Science + Physics and Elective/Further Math. Aggregate: 36 or better.
2. SSSCE: Credits in same core/electives. Aggregate: 24 or better.
3. NECO: Same as above. Aggregate: 24 or better.
4. GCE: 5 O-level credits including English and Math + 3 A-level passes (one in Math).
5. Equivalent qualifications: IB (10/20), IGCSE A & O levels, American Grade 12 (GPA ≥ 3.0), City & Guilds Technician Diplomas.
6. HND: In Engineering/IT fields, with Second Class Lower + 2 years experience.
7. Mature Entry: Age 25+, proof of age, and pass in RMU entrance exam (English, Math, Aptitude Test).

What is the admission policy of the Regional Maritime University (RMU)?

RMU admits students based on academic merit and ability to succeed in their chosen program. The policy ensures:

- Offers are made to qualified applicants with appropriate background.
- Admission is merit-based.
- RMU is an equal opportunity, secular, and co-educational institution. All qualified candidates can apply regardless of nationality or background.

What are the requirements for transfer students at the Regional Maritime University (RMU)?
Transfer students must accumulate at least 64 credits over 4 semesters as full-time students at RMU. Graduation eligibility and degree classification are based solely on courses taken at RMU.
What is the Visiting Studentship (Special Admissions) programme at RMU?

It allows students from foreign universities who have completed two years of higher education to spend their third year at RMU, earn transferable credits, and return home to complete their degree. CGPA must be 3.0 or higher and applicants must be under an academic credit transfer agreement.
What are the conditions for candidates transferring from another university to RMU?

Candidates must be formally admitted to a Bachelor's program at a recognized university, have completed at least one academic year with satisfactory progress, and submit academic transcripts for evaluation by RMU’s Joint Admissions Board.
What are the guidelines for credit transfer at the Regional Maritime University (RMU)?

RMU accepts transfer credits from accredited institutions if courses are parallel to its programs. Conditions:
- Minimum grade of D (higher grades may be needed for major courses).
- All transfer work is audited and re-evaluated.
- Admissions Office checks course equivalence; departments determine program fit.
- Associate degrees may cover general education, but Bachelor’s degree is still required.
- Certain associate degrees (e.g., Applied Science) and religious credits may not qualify.
What are the entry requirements for Level 200 or 300 for all B.Sc. programmes at RMU?
Applicants with RMU Higher Diplomas, relevant HNDs, or equivalent qualifications may be admitted into Level 200 or 300 after individual assessment by the University.
What are the admission requirements for the Diploma in Information Technology and Diploma in Ports and Shipping Management at RMU?

Accepted qualifications:
- SSSCE/WASSCE/NECO: Six passes including English and Math, plus C6 or better in 3 electives.
- GCE: 5 O-level credits including English and Math + 2 A-level passes in relevant subjects.
- GBCME: Five passes including English, Math, and two relevant electives.
What are the admission requirements for Diploma in Marine Engineering, Nautical Science, or Electrical/Electronic Engineering (Regular/Weekend)?

Accepted qualifications:
- SSSCE: 6 passes including English, Math, Integrated Science, and relevant electives like Physics or Elective Math.
- GCE: 5 O-levels including English and Math + 2 A-level passes in sciences.
- Other options: IB (min 10/20), American Grade 12 (GPA ≥ 3.0), IGCSE/Cambridge A+O levels, or City & Guilds Advanced Diploma.
What is the University Code of Ethics at RMU and what is its purpose?

The University Code of Ethics at RMU sets a culture of openness, transparency, accountability, trust, and integrity in all dealings involving staff, students, officers, council members, and contractors. It promotes high professional and ethical standards in academic and business affairs. Members are expected to uphold institutional values even in situations not explicitly covered by the Code.
What is the University Code of Ethics and Conduct at RMU, and what behaviors are prohibited?

The Code defines acceptable behavior at RMU and outlines prohibited conduct:

Academic Misconduct: Cheating, plagiarism, threats, false alarms, unauthorized firearms, drug/alcohol use, smoking.
Disruption: Interfering with classes, document falsification, slander, fire safety violations, off-campus misconduct.
Property Misuse: Theft, unauthorized access, computer abuse.
Interpersonal Issues: Discriminatory or sexual harassment, hazing, inappropriate relationships.
Dress Code: Formal wear for both male/female; ban on sagging, loud hairstyles, strapless clothing, etc.
Other Offenses: Unauthorized protests, political activities, gambling, sexual misconduct.
Penalties: Violations are handled per RMU Act and disciplinary rules.
What are RMU’s policies on unspecified offences, criminal offences, and conflict resolution?

Unspecified Offenses: RMU will determine penalties on a case-by-case basis.
Criminal Offenses: Violations of Ghana law are referred to law enforcement, with possible RMU sanctions after resolution.
Conflict Resolution:
- Student–Student: Handled by class advisor or Head of Department.
- Staff–Student: Escalated from student coordinator to staff’s unit head.
Note: Cadets and residents are also bound by residential and Corps rules.
What is the Orientation Programme for fresh students at RMU?

All new students undergo orientation within the first month. It introduces them to university services, rules, and personnel including the Vice Chancellor and academic staff, to help them transition smoothly into academic life.
What is Matriculation at RMU and what does it involve?
Matriculation is a formal admission ceremony. Students sign a declaration to uphold RMU rules. Formal attire is mandatory.
What is a Matriculation Number and why is it important at RMU?
Every student is assigned a unique matriculation number, which is required for all official transactions. It must be retained throughout the student’s academic life. Having two numbers is prohibited.
What are the guidelines for Identity Cards and Registration at RMU?
Students receive a University ID upon registration and payment. It must be carried at all times and shown on request. ID cards are returned at graduation or withdrawal.
Can students at RMU change their names during their programme?
No. RMU does not permit name changes during the academic programme as part of institutional policy.
What is Congregation at RMU and who participates?

Congregation is RMU's official graduation event for students who complete academic and financial requirements. Degrees and certificates are awarded in the presence of the Board, Convocation, and others.
What is the policy on student accommodation in the Halls of Residence at RMU?

RMU provides Halls of Residence to support students' academic and social development. Accommodation is compulsory for first and second year students in Marine Engineering and Nautical Science due to cadetship training. Other spaces are limited and prioritized for fresh foreign nationals. Key guidelines include:

- Only bona fide registered students are eligible.
- Students must apply through the Academic Registrar every semester.
- Names of accepted applicants are published.
- Fees must be paid before receiving an Offer for Residential Accommodation.
- Room allocation is done by the House Master after attestation by the Students Coordinator.
- Bed space costs:
  * $70 per cadet
  * $172.22 for 8 occupants
  * $252.22 for 3–4 occupants
What are the conditions of room occupancy in RMU hostels?

- Unauthorized bed transfers are prohibited.
- Rooms must be vacated during semester breaks.
- Room rights are non-transferable.
- Students must maintain cleanliness in all hostel areas.
- Squatting is strictly forbidden.
- Property damage leads to liability and disciplinary action.
- Noise, including religious audio, must be kept moderate.
- Sexual activity is not permitted.
- All university property must be returned at semester end.
- Visitation hours:
  * Cadets: until 10:00pm
  * Non-cadets: until 11:00pm
What are the rules for electrical appliances, fire, and fire prevention in RMU hostels?

- Prohibited appliances: electric cookers, toasters, grills, immersion heaters, TVs, fridges, ovens, etc., unless in designated areas.
- Candles are not permitted when electricity is available.
- Smoking is banned in all hostel areas.
- All fire incidents are investigated by the Security Company/Maritime Safety Department and reported to the University Committee on Security.
- Disciplinary or legal action will follow based on international fire codes and RMU regulations.
What is RMU’s policy on loss of personal property in halls of residence?

The University does not accept responsibility for any loss of personal property in the halls. Students must report such incidents to the Coordinator of Student Affairs and then to the Security Company or Administration. Further details are outlined in the rules of residence available from the Commandant.
Can students stay in RMU halls during vacation?

Yes, but only under exceptional circumstances. All students must return keys to the Porter on duty at the end of each semester. To stay during vacation, a student must:

- Provide sufficient reason
- Obtain approval
- Pay a prescribed fee
What is the role of the Students’ Representative Council (SRC) at RMU?

The SRC serves as the official organ of the student body. It is elected by the general student population and is responsible for:

- Representing student concerns
- Promoting student welfare
- Coordinating academic, cultural, intellectual, and recreational activities
The SRC channels student concerns to the appropriate university bodies.
How are student organizations regulated at RMU?

RMU allows students to organize themselves into recognized student groups under these conditions:

- Activities must align with the University’s educational and social policies
- Groups must have a permanent structure (constitution, rules, funding)
- Groups must have a student membership base and an Adviser/Patron (a full-time university staff)
- At least 20 full-time students must form the core of the group
- Discriminatory or tribal, religious, or ethnic-based organizations are not allowed
- Applications must be submitted to the Coordinator of Student Affairs

Required documents include:
- Two copies of constitution and bye-laws
- Names and contacts of leaders and adviser
- Statement of financial support and purpose
- Sponsorship approval (if from a department)
What privileges do recognized student organizations have at RMU?

Registered student organizations are entitled to:

* Recruit members from within the RMU community
* Use University facilities (subject to approval and payment)
* Use the University’s name as part of their official title
* Apply for financial or logistical support for approved activities
Under what conditions can RMU withdraw recognition of a student organization?

Recognition may be withdrawn if:

* The group fails to follow the administrative or registration procedures
* The group violates the rules and regulations of the University
What are the key regulations governing student organizations at RMU?

1. Only registered RMU students may join; others require special provision in the group’s constitution.
2. Organizations must maintain proper financial records. All funds are subject to Student Welfare Board oversight.
3. Coordinators must accept responsibility for all group activities.
4. Affiliated organizations may apply for funding, but the sponsoring department is jointly accountable.
5. No organization may act on behalf of RMU without official approval.
6. All organizations must comply with University regulations. Infractions may lead to sanctions.
7. Registration must be renewed each academic session, with submission of:
   * Staff adviser’s name and signature
   * Names of current leaders and their department/hall
   * Copy of previous year’s constitution and by-laws
   * Approved schedule of meetings and events
What is the minimum and maximum course load per semester at RMU?
A student must register for a minimum of 16 credits and a maximum of 24 credits per semester.
What grading system is used at RMU?

RMU uses the following grading scale:

| Grade | % Mark | Grade Point (GP) | Interpretation |
|-------|--------|------------------|----------------|
| A     | 80–100 | 4.00             | Outstanding    |
| A-    |        | 3.85             | Excellent      |
| B+    | 75–79  | 3.50             | Very Good      |
| B     | 70–74  | 3.00             | Good           |
| C+    | 65–69  | 2.50             | Above Average  |
| C     | 60–64  | 2.00             | Average        |
| D     | 55–59  | 1.50             | Pass           |
| E     | 50–54  | 1.00             | Weak Pass      |
| F     | 0–49   | 0.00             | Fail           |

Other notations: X = Fail, Z = Disqualified, I = Incomplete, Y = Continuing, S = Sick, M = Owing
How is GPA and CGPA calculated at RMU?

GPA (Grade Point Average) per semester is calculated as:
GPA = (Sum of Credit Hours × Grade Points) / Total Credit Hours

CGPA (Cumulative GPA) is the average of GPA across all semesters.
What is the classification of degrees based on CGPA at RMU?

CGPA and Classification:
- 3.60 and above: 1st Class
- 3.00 – 3.59: 2nd Class Upper
- 2.50 – 2.99: 2nd Class Lower
- 2.00 – 2.49: 3rd Class
- 1.50 – 1.99: Pass
- Below 1.49: Fail (No Certificate)
Can you give an example of GPA calculation?

Example:
Course 1 (3 credits, Grade B = 3.0) → 9.0 WGP
Course 2 (2 credits, Grade C+ = 2.5) → 5.0 WGP
Course 3 (3 credits, Grade C = 2.0) → 6.0 WGP
Course 4 (1 credit, Grade D = 1.0) → 1.0 WGP
Total WGP = 21.0, Total Credits = 9
GPA = 21 / 9 = 2.33

How can a student request a transcript of academic records at RMU?

Submit a written request to the Registrar’s Office, pay the required fee, and provide advance notice. The transcript includes only academic records from RMU. No transcript will be released if financial obligations are not met, and grades earned cannot be deleted under any circumstance.
Who is eligible to sit for exams at RMU?
Students must meet all Departmental requirements and attend at least 75% of contact hours. Attendance at lectures, practicals, and tutorials is mandatory.
How are students assessed at RMU?
Evaluation is based on Continuous Assessment (40%) and End-of-Semester Exams (60%). Assessments include essays, quizzes, tests, reports, and oral/project work. The pass mark is 45% for all courses.
What are the rules for deferment of examinations at RMU?

Students deferring due to ill-health must submit a medical certificate to the Registrar through the Head of Department. For other reasons, students must write formally to the Provost via the HoD and Dean and obtain written permission from the Registrar before deferring.
How are examination results declared at RMU?

The Department Examination Committee submits results to the Faculty Board and then to the Academic Council. Final results are posted on official notice boards. Students may obtain printed statements after publication. Results for graduates go to the Registrar after Academic Council approval.
What is RMU’s policy on academic progression and withdrawal?

Progression is based on CGPA and minimum credits passed at each level. Level 100: Pass (CGPA ≥ 1.50), Repeat (CGPA 1.00–1.49), Withdraw (CGPA < 1.00). Level 200: Pass (CGPA ≥ 1.50 + ≥ 24 credits), Probation (CGPA ≥ 1.50 + 18–23 credits), Withdraw (below threshold). Level 300: Pass (CGPA ≥ 1.50 + ≥ 60 credits), Probation (CGPA ≥ 1.50 + 48–59 credits), Withdraw (below threshold). After a year of probation without improvement, withdrawal may be enforced by the Registrar.

Where is the Regional Maritime University (RMU) located?

RMU is situated on the coastline, offering access to an extensive shoreline. Its proximity to the Port of Tema (about five minutes’ drive) gives students practical exposure in ship operation, fisheries, and dry dock repair.

The university's distance from city noise offers a calm and peaceful environment ideal for teaching and learning.

What are the general admission requirements for B.Sc. Marine Engineering, Electrical/Electronics Engineering, Nautical Science, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, and Mechanical Engineering at RMU?

Admission into these programs requires any of the following:

1. WASSCE: Credits in English, Math, Integrated Science + Physics and Elective/Further Math. Aggregate: 36 or better.
2. SSSCE: Credits in same core/electives. Aggregate: 24 or better.
3. NECO: Same as above. Aggregate: 24 or better.
4. GCE: 5 O-level credits including English and Math + 3 A-level passes (one in Math).
5. Equivalent qualifications: IB (10/20), IGCSE A & O levels, American Grade 12 (GPA ≥ 3.0), City & Guilds Technician Diplomas.
6. HND: In Engineering/IT fields, with Second Class Lower + 2 years experience.
7. Mature Entry: Age 25+, proof of age, and pass in RMU entrance exam (English, Math, Aptitude Test).

What is the admission policy of the Regional Maritime University (RMU)?

- Offers are made to qualified applicants with appropriate background.
- Admission is merit-based.
- RMU is an equal opportunity, secular, and co-educational institution. All qualified candidates can apply regardless of nationality or background.

What are the requirements for transfer students at the Regional Maritime University (RMU)?
Transfer students must accumulate at least 64 credits over 4 semesters as full-time students at RMU. Graduation eligibility and degree classification are based solely on courses taken at RMU.
What is the Visiting Studentship (Special Admissions) programme at RMU?

It allows students from foreign universities who have completed two years of higher education to spend their third year at RMU, earn transferable credits, and return home to complete their degree. CGPA must be 3.0 or higher and applicants must be under an academic credit transfer agreement.
What are the conditions for candidates transferring from another university to RMU?

Candidates must be formally admitted to a Bachelor's program at a recognized university, have completed at least one academic year with satisfactory progress, and submit academic transcripts for evaluation by RMU’s Joint Admissions Board.
What are the guidelines for credit transfer at the Regional Maritime University (RMU)?

RMU accepts transfer credits from accredited institutions if courses are parallel to its programs. Conditions:
- Minimum grade of D (higher grades may be needed for major courses).
- All transfer work is audited and re-evaluated.
- Admissions Office checks course equivalence; departments determine program fit.
- Associate degrees may cover general education, but Bachelor’s degree is still required.
- Certain associate degrees (e.g., Applied Science) and religious credits may not qualify.
What are the entry requirements for Level 200 or 300 for all B.Sc. programmes at RMU?
Applicants with RMU Higher Diplomas, relevant HNDs, or equivalent qualifications may be admitted into Level 200 or 300 after individual assessment by the University.
What are the admission requirements for the Diploma in Information Technology and Diploma in Ports and Shipping Management at RMU?

Accepted qualifications:
- SSSCE/WASSCE/NECO: Six passes including English and Math, plus C6 or better in 3 electives.
- GCE: 5 O-level credits including English and Math + 2 A-level passes in relevant subjects.
- GBCME: Five passes including English, Math, and two relevant electives.
What are the admission requirements for Diploma in Marine Engineering, Nautical Science, or Electrical/Electronic Engineering (Regular/Weekend)?

Accepted qualifications:
- SSSCE: 6 passes including English, Math, Integrated Science, and relevant electives like Physics or Elective Math.
- GCE: 5 O-levels including English and Math + 2 A-level passes in sciences.
- Other options: IB (min 10/20), American Grade 12 (GPA ≥ 3.0), IGCSE/Cambridge A+O levels, or City & Guilds Advanced Diploma.
What is the University Code of Ethics at RMU and what is its purpose?

The University Code of Ethics at RMU sets a culture of openness, transparency, accountability, trust, and integrity in all dealings involving staff, students, officers, council members, and contractors. It promotes high professional and ethical standards in academic and business affairs. Members are expected to uphold institutional values even in situations not explicitly covered by the Code.
What is the University Code of Ethics and Conduct at RMU, and what behaviors are prohibited?

The Code defines acceptable behavior at RMU and outlines prohibited conduct:

Academic Misconduct: Cheating, plagiarism, threats, false alarms, unauthorized firearms, drug/alcohol use, smoking.
Disruption: Interfering with classes, document falsification, slander, fire safety violations, off-campus misconduct.
Property Misuse: Theft, unauthorized access, computer abuse.
Interpersonal Issues: Discriminatory or sexual harassment, hazing, inappropriate relationships.
Dress Code: Formal wear for both male/female; ban on sagging, loud hairstyles, strapless clothing, etc.
Other Offenses: Unauthorized protests, political activities, gambling, sexual misconduct.
Penalties: Violations are handled per RMU Act and disciplinary rules.
What are RMU’s policies on unspecified offences, criminal offences, and conflict resolution?

Unspecified Offenses: RMU will determine penalties on a case-by-case basis.
Criminal Offenses: Violations of Ghana law are referred to law enforcement, with possible RMU sanctions after resolution.
Conflict Resolution:
- Student–Student: Handled by class advisor or Head of Department.
- Staff–Student: Escalated from student coordinator to staff’s unit head.
Note: Cadets and residents are also bound by residential and Corps rules.
What is the Orientation Programme for fresh students at RMU?

All new students undergo orientation within the first month. It introduces them to university services, rules, and personnel including the Vice Chancellor and academic staff, to help them transition smoothly into academic life.
What is Matriculation at RMU and what does it involve?
Matriculation is a formal admission ceremony. Students sign a declaration to uphold RMU rules. Formal attire is mandatory.
What is a Matriculation Number and why is it important at RMU?
Every student is assigned a unique matriculation number, which is required for all official transactions. It must be retained throughout the student’s academic life. Having two numbers is prohibited.
What are the guidelines for Identity Cards and Registration at RMU?
Students receive a University ID upon registration and payment. It must be carried at all times and shown on request. ID cards are returned at graduation or withdrawal.
Can students at RMU change their names during their programme?
No. RMU does not permit name changes during the academic programme as part of institutional policy.
What is Congregation at RMU and who participates?

Congregation is RMU's official graduation event for students who complete academic and financial requirements. Degrees and certificates are awarded in the presence of the Board, Convocation, and others.
What is the policy on student accommodation in the Halls of Residence at RMU?

RMU provides Halls of Residence to support students' academic and social development. Accommodation is compulsory for first and second year students in Marine Engineering and Nautical Science due to cadetship training. Other spaces are limited and prioritized for fresh foreign nationals. Key guidelines include:

- Only bona fide registered students are eligible.
- Students must apply through the Academic Registrar every semester.
- Names of accepted applicants are published.
- Fees must be paid before receiving an Offer for Residential Accommodation.

  * $172.22 for 8 occupants
  * $252.22 for 3–4 occupants
What are the conditions of room occupancy in RMU hostels?

- Unauthorized bed transfers are prohibited.
- Rooms must be vacated during semester breaks.
- Room rights are non-transferable.
- Students must maintain cleanliness in all hostel areas.
- Squatting is strictly forbidden.
- Property damage leads to liability and disciplinary action.
- Noise, including religious audio, must be kept moderate.
- Sexual activity is not permitted.
- All university property must be returned at semester end.

  * Non-cadets: until 11:00pm
What are the rules for electrical appliances, fire, and fire prevention in RMU hostels?

- Candles are not permitted when electricity is available.
- Smoking is banned in all hostel areas.

- Disciplinary or legal action will follow based on international fire codes and RMU regulations.
What is RMU’s policy on loss of personal property in halls of residence?

The University does not accept responsibility for any loss of personal property in the halls. Students must report such incidents to the Coordinator of Student Affairs and then to the Security Company or Administration. Further details are outlined in the rules of residence available from the Commandant.
Can students stay in RMU halls during vacation?

Yes, but only under exceptional circumstances. All students must return keys to the Porter on duty at the end of each semester. To stay during vacation, a student must:

- Provide sufficient reason
- Obtain approval
- Pay a prescribed fee
What is the role of the Students’ Representative Council (SRC) at RMU?

The SRC serves as the official organ of the student body. It is elected by the general student population and is responsible for:

- Representing student concerns
- Promoting student welfare
- Coordinating academic, cultural, intellectual, and recreational activities
The SRC channels student concerns to the appropriate university bodies.
How are student organizations regulated at RMU?

RMU allows students to organize themselves into recognized student groups under these conditions:

- Activities must align with the University’s educational and social policies
- Groups must have a permanent structure (constitution, rules, funding)
- Groups must have a student membership base and an Adviser/Patron (a full-time university staff)

What privileges do recognized student organizations have at RMU?

Registered student organizations are entitled to:

* Apply for financial or logistical support for approved activities
Under what conditions can RMU withdraw recognition of a student organization?

Recognition may be withdrawn if:

* The group violates the rules and regulations of the University
What are the key regulations governing student organizations at RMU?

What grading system is used at RMU?

RMU uses the following grading scale:

| Grade | % Mark | Grade Point (GP) | Interpretation |
|-------|--------|------------------|----------------|
| A     | 80–100 | 4.00             | Outstanding    |
| A-    |        | 3.85             | Excellent      |
| B+    | 75–79  | 3.50             | Very Good      |
| B     | 70–74  | 3.00             | Good           |
| C+    | 65–69  | 2.50             | Above Average  |
| C     | 60–64  | 2.00             | Average        |
| D     | 55–59  | 1.50             | Pass           |
| E     | 50–54  | 1.00             | Weak Pass      |

How is GPA and CGPA calculated at RMU?

GPA (Grade Point Average) per semester is calculated as:
GPA = (Sum of Credit Hours × Grade Points) / Total Credit Hours

CGPA (Cumulative GPA) is the average of GPA across all semesters.
What is the classification of degrees based on CGPA at RMU?

CGPA and Classification:
- 3.60 and above: 1st Class
- 3.00 – 3.59: 2nd Class Upper
- 2.50 – 2.99: 2nd Class Lower
- 2.00 – 2.49: 3rd Class
- 1.50 – 1.99: Pass
- Below 1.49: Fail (No Certificate)
Can you give an example of GPA calculation?

Example:
Course 1 (3 credits, Grade B = 3.0) → 9.0 WGP
Course 2 (2 credits, Grade C+ = 2.5) → 5.0 WGP
Course 3 (3 credits, Grade C = 2.0) → 6.0 WGP
Course 4 (1 credit, Grade D = 1.0) → 1.0 WGP
Total WGP = 21.0, Total Credits = 9
GPA = 21 / 9 = 2.33

What is RMU’s policy on academic progression and withdrawal?

Progression is based on CGPA and minimum credits passed at each level. Level 100: Pass (CGPA ≥ 1.50), Repeat (CGPA 1.00–1.49), Withdraw (CGPA < 1.00). Level 200: Pass (CGPA ≥ 1.50 + ≥ 24 credits), Probation (CGPA ≥ 1.50 + 18–23 credits), Withdraw (below threshold). Where is the Regional Maritime University (RMU) located?

The university's distance from city noise offers a calm and peaceful environment ideal for teaching and learning.
What is the role of the Vice Chancellor at the Regional Maritime University?

What are the general admission requirements for B.Sc. Marine Engineering, Electrical/Electronics Engineering, Nautical Science, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, and Mechanical Engineering at RMU?

What are the requirements for transfer students at the Regional Maritime University (RMU)?
Transfer students must accumulate at least 64 credits over 4 semesters as full-time students at RMU. Graduation eligibility and degree classification are based solely on courses taken at RMU.
What is the Visiting Studentship (Special Admissions) programme at RMU?

It allows students from foreign universities who have completed two years of higher education to spend their third year at RMU, earn transferable credits, and return home to complete their degree. CGPA must be 3.0 or higher and applicants must be under an academic credit transfer agreement.
What are the conditions for candidates transferring from another university to RMU?

Candidates must be formally admitted to a Bachelor's program at a recognized university, have completed at least one academic year with satisfactory progress, and submit academic transcripts for evaluation by RMU’s Joint Admissions Board.
What are the guidelines for credit transfer at the Regional Maritime University (RMU)?

RMU accepts transfer credits from accredited institutions if courses are parallel to its programs. Conditions:
- Minimum grade of D (higher grades may be needed for major courses).
- All transfer work is audited and re-evaluated.
- Admissions Office checks course equivalence; departments determine program fit.
- Associate degrees may cover general education, but Bachelor’s degree is still required.
- Certain associate degrees (e.g., Applied Science) and religious credits may not qualify.
What are the entry requirements for Level 200 or 300 for all B.Sc. programmes at RMU?
Applicants with RMU Higher Diplomas, relevant HNDs, or equivalent qualifications may be admitted into Level 200 or 300 after individual assessment by the University.
What are the admission requirements for the Diploma in Information Technology and Diploma in Ports and Shipping Management at RMU?

- GCE: 5 O-level credits including English and Math + 2 A-level passes in relevant subjects.
- GBCME: Five passes including English, Math, and two relevant electives.
What are the admission requirements for Diploma in Marine Engineering, Nautical Science, or Electrical/Electronic Engineering (Regular/Weekend)?

- GCE: 5 O-levels including English and Math + 2 A-level passes in sciences.
- Other options: IB (min 10/20), American Grade 12 (GPA ≥ 3.0), IGCSE/Cambridge A+O levels, or City & Guilds Advanced Diploma.
What is the University Code of Ethics at RMU and what is its purpose?

The University Code of Ethics at RMU sets a culture of openness, transparency, accountability, trust, and integrity in all dealings involving staff, students, officers, council members, and contractors. It promotes high professional and ethical standards in academic and business affairs. Members are expected to uphold institutional values even in situations not explicitly covered by the Code.
What is the University Code of Ethics and Conduct at RMU, and what behaviors are prohibited?

The Code defines acceptable behavior at RMU and outlines prohibited conduct:

Academic Misconduct: Cheating, plagiarism, threats, false alarms, unauthorized firearms, drug/alcohol use, smoking.
Disruption: Interfering with classes, document falsification, slander, fire safety violations, off-campus misconduct.
Property Misuse: Theft, unauthorized access, computer abuse.
Interpersonal Issues: Discriminatory or sexual harassment, hazing, inappropriate relationships.
Dress Code: Formal wear for both male/female; ban on sagging, loud hairstyles, strapless clothing, etc.
Other Offenses: Unauthorized protests, political activities, gambling, sexual misconduct.
Penalties: Violations are handled per RMU Act and disciplinary rules.
What are RMU’s policies on unspecified offences, criminal offences, and conflict resolution?

Unspecified Offenses: RMU will determine penalties on a case-by-case basis.
Criminal Offenses: Violations of Ghana law are referred to law enforcement, with possible RMU sanctions after resolution.
Conflict Resolution:
- Student–Student: Handled by class advisor or Head of Department.
- Staff–Student: Escalated from student coordinator to staff’s unit head.
Note: Cadets and residents are also bound by residential and Corps rules.
What is the Orientation Programme for fresh students at RMU?

All new students undergo orientation within the first month. It introduces them to university services, rules, and personnel including the Vice Chancellor and academic staff, to help them transition smoothly into academic life.
What is Matriculation at RMU and what does it involve?
Matriculation is a formal admission ceremony. Students sign a declaration to uphold RMU rules. Formal attire is mandatory.
What is a Matriculation Number and why is it important at RMU?
Every student is assigned a unique matriculation number, which is required for all official transactions. It must be retained throughout the student’s academic life. Having two numbers is prohibited.
What are the guidelines for Identity Cards and Registration at RMU?
Students receive a University ID upon registration and payment. It must be carried at all times and shown on request. ID cards are returned at graduation or withdrawal.
Can students at RMU change their names during their programme?
No. RMU does not permit name changes during the academic programme as part of institutional policy.
What is Congregation at RMU and who participates?

Congregation is RMU's official graduation event for students who complete academic and financial requirements. Degrees and certificates are awarded in the presence of the Board, Convocation, and others.
What is the policy on student accommodation in the Halls of Residence at RMU?

RMU provides Halls of Residence to support students' academic and social development. Accommodation is compulsory for first and second year students in Marine Engineering and Nautical Science due to cadetship training. Other spaces are limited and prioritized for fresh foreign nationals. Key guidelines include:

- Only bona fide registered students are eligible.
- Students must apply through the Academic Registrar every semester.
- Names of accepted applicants are published.
- Fees must be paid before receiving an Offer for Residential Accommodation.
- Room allocation is done by the House Master after attestation by the Students Coordinator.
- Bed space costs:
  * $70 per cadet
  * $172.22 for 8 occupants
  * $252.22 for 3–4 occupants
What are the conditions of room occupancy in RMU hostels?

- Unauthorized bed transfers are prohibited.
- Rooms must be vacated during semester breaks.
- Room rights are non-transferable.
- Students must maintain cleanliness in all hostel areas.
- Squatting is strictly forbidden.
- Property damage leads to liability and disciplinary action.
- Noise, including religious audio, must be kept moderate.
- Sexual activity is not permitted.
- All university property must be returned at semester end.
- Visitation hours:
  * Cadets: until 10:00pm
  * Non-cadets: until 11:00pm
What are the rules for electrical appliances, fire, and fire prevention in RMU hostels?

- Prohibited appliances: electric cookers, toasters, grills, immersion heaters, TVs, fridges, ovens, etc., unless in designated areas.
- Candles are not permitted when electricity is available.
- Smoking is banned in all hostel areas.
- All fire incidents are investigated by the Security Company/Maritime Safety Department and reported to the University Committee on Security.
- Disciplinary or legal action will follow based on international fire codes and RMU regulations.
What is RMU’s policy on loss of personal property in halls of residence?

The University does not accept responsibility for any loss of personal property in the halls. Students must report such incidents to the Coordinator of Student Affairs and then to the Security Company or Administration. Further details are outlined in the rules of residence available from the Commandant.
Can students stay in RMU halls during vacation?

Yes, but only under exceptional circumstances. All students must return keys to the Porter on duty at the end of each semester. To stay during vacation, a student must:

- Provide sufficient reason
- Obtain approval
- Pay a prescribed fee
What is the role of the Students’ Representative Council (SRC) at RMU?

How is GPA and CGPA calculated at RMU?

GPA (Grade Point Average) per semester is calculated as:
GPA = (Sum of Credit Hours × Grade Points) / Total Credit Hours

CGPA (Cumulative GPA) is the average of GPA across all semesters.
What is the classification of degrees based on CGPA at RMU?

- 3.00 – 3.59: 2nd Class Upper
- 2.50 – 2.99: 2nd Class Lower
- 2.00 – 2.49: 3rd Class
- 1.50 – 1.99: Pass
- Below 1.49: Fail (No Certificate)
Can you give an example of GPA calculation?

Example:
Course 1 (3 credits, Grade B = 3.0) → 9.0 WGP
Course 2 (2 credits, Grade C+ = 2.5) → 5.0 WGP
Course 3 (3 credits, Grade C = 2.0) → 6.0 WGP
Course 4 (1 credit, Grade D = 1.0) → 1.0 WGP
Total WGP = 21.0, Total Credits = 9

What is RMU’s policy on academic progression and withdrawal?

Level 200: Pass (CGPA ≥ 1.50 + ≥ 24 credits), Probation (CGPA ≥ 1.50 + 18–23 credits), Withdraw (below threshold). RMU uses the following grading scale: A (80–100) = 4.00 (Outstanding), B+ (75–79) = 3.50 (Very Good), B (70–74) = 3.00 (Good), C+ (65–69) = 2.50 (Above Average), C (60–64) = 2.00 (Average), D (55–59) = 1.50 (Pass), E (50–54) = 1.00 (Weak Pass), F (0–49) = 0.00 (Fail).
What is the maximum number of credits a student can take per semester?
A student is expected to carry a minimum of 16 and a maximum of 24 credits per semester.
What programming languages are taught in the Marine Engineering program?
Students learn programming through 'Computer Studies I' in Year 1 and continue with C++ in Year 2 under 'Programming Language I (C++)'.
What course introduces students to control systems in Marine Engineering?
Control Engineering I in Year 3 Semester 2 introduces students to control systems, followed by Control Engineering II in Year 4.
What programming languages are covered in BSc. Computer Science?
Students learn C (Computer Studies II), C++ (Programming with C++), Java (Programming Language III), and .NET (Programming with .Net).
Are there any courses in data science for Computer Science students?
Yes, students take 'Data Mining and Warehousing' in Year 3 and 'Database Systems' from Year 2.
What career path does the Electrical/Electronic Engineering program support?
The program prepares students for careers as electro-technical officers and in electrical/electronic services and manufacturing industries.
Does the Electrical/Electronic Engineering program cover communication systems?
Yes, courses such as 'Communication Engineering I & III' and 'Telecommunication' are part of the curriculum.
What are the core subjects in the BSc. Nautical Science program?
Core subjects include Navigation, Meteorology, Shipboard Operations, Marine Engineering Systems, and Law.
What is the total credit for Year 1 Semester 1 of B.Sc. Logistics Management?
The total credit for Year 1 Semester 1 is 15 credit hours.
Which course introduces logistics students to international trade?
The course 'BLGM 103 – International Trade' in Year 1 Semester 2 covers that.
What practical experience is required in Year 4?
Students undertake 'Internship in Enterprise (minimum 4 weeks)' in Year 4 Semester 1 and submit a 'Research Paper' in Semester 2.
What is the primary aim of the Diploma in Ports and Shipping Management?
To familiarize students with port and shipping technology, operations, policies, and information systems for supervisory roles.
How many semesters are in the diploma programme?
The programme runs for 2 years, comprising 4 semesters.
What is the final year project requirement?
'Project Work' in Year 2 Semester 2, worth 3 credit hours. This will total to 6 credit hours for the whole year.
What course introduces shipboard operations in Year 1?
BNAs 103 – Shipboard Operations I.
How many credits is Navigation V worth?
3 credits in Year 4 Semester 2.
What course is taken in Year 4 Semester 1 to simulate ship handling?
BNAs 405 – Ship Handling Simulator.
What programming languages are taught in the curriculum?
C++ in Year 2 Semester 2, Java in Year 3 Semester 1, and .Net in Year 3 Semester 1.
What course is focused on data mining?
BCME 308 – Data Mining and Warehousing in Year 3 Semester 2.
What project is completed in Year 4 Semester 2?
BCME 410 – Project.
What major area does BEEE 405 cover?
Microprocessor Systems (Applications) in Year 4 Semester 1.
What is taught in BEEE 304?
Communication Engineering II in Year 3 Semester 2.
Which subject focuses on Electric Motor Drives?
BEEE 408 – Electric Motor Drives in Year 4 Semester 2.
What courses are offered in Year 1 Semester 1 of B.Sc. Computer Science?

The Year 1 Semester 1 courses include:

* Applied Electricity (BEEE 101) – 3 credits
* Communication Skills/Academic Writing Skills (UCOM 101) – 2 credits
* Computer Studies I (Intro. to Computer Applications) (BCME 101) – 3 credits
* Moral & Ethical Issues (BCME 105) – 2 credits
* French I (UFRE 101) – 2 credits
* Mathematics I (Algebra With Analysis) (BSMA 101) – 3 credits

What is taught in Year 1 Semester 2 for Computer Science at RMU?

* Academic Writing Skills (UCOM 106) – 2 credits
* Computer Studies II (Introduction to C Programming) (BCMT 102) – 3 credits
* Circuit Theory (BEEE 102) – 3 credits
* Electronics I (BEEE 106) – 3 credits

Which programming courses are covered in Year 2 of Computer Science?

What elective options are available in Year 4 for Computer Science students?

In Year 4, students are required to take up to two elective courses each semester. These electives can be selected from a list of departmental or inter-departmental offerings, provided the student hasn’t taken them before and meets any prerequisites. Elective slots are marked as "Elective**" in both Year 4 Semester 1 and Semester 2 schedules.
How many credits are required in Year 3 Semester 1 for B.Sc. Computer Science?

Year 3 Semester 1 has the following courses and credit values:

* Computer Communication Networks (BCME 301) – 3 credits
* Web Technologies (BCME 315) – 3 credits
* Data Structures & Algorithms (BCMT 305) – 3 credits
* Computer Architecture (BCME 307) – 3 credits
* Operating Systems (BCME 309) – 3 credits
* Programming Language III (Java) (BCME 311) – 3 credits
